channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Apple’s self-repair program disappoints right-to-repair advocates
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The backstory: Last month, Apple launched its Self Service Repair Store, which allows customers to buy parts for select Apple devices they can repair at home. Apple said in a white paper last month, “For the vast majority of customers, the safest and most reliable repair is achieved through an Apple Store. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Bottom line: Critics say Apple doesn’t want customers to repair their phones at home, and, when this program proves to be unpopular, will use it as evidence against right-to-repair initiatives.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Hey, Miso Robot—can I get fries with that?
item.description: That’s what the future of quick-service restaurants (QSR) could look like with Miso Robotics. When it’s combined, you see a robot doing the work of roughly two people during peak periods in a quiet, seamless, and very efficient way. We're not just going to wake up one day, and there’ll be 1.5 million new workers happily jumping into the restaurant industry. We really see ourselves as a solution to the labor crisis in the quick serve restaurant industry. from our sponsorFired up about Flippy and its robot siblings? When someone sees Flippy taking frozen fries all the way through to the cook station and serving cooked fries, you can kinda just drop the mic. What do you see Miso’s role in the restaurant industry? And the automation guy is saying, “I think that the technology has now evolved in such a way that it’s approachable and affordable today for a robot to take over some of the tasks.” What Flippy does is simple: It takes frozen fries all the way through the fry process and dispenses cooked fries. Yeah, so if you look at fast-food restaurants, fries go with almost every order. Miso is still open to investors as they take on the $300B US Quick Serve Restaurant Industry. I was talking to some of the workers who have had one of our Flippy units installed for the longest period of time. Our mission is to automate restaurants, and we’re starting with automating fry stations. Where did the idea for the Flippy come from?
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: Flowcarbon raises $70 million to tokenize carbon offsets
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe blockchain startup Flowcarbon landed $70 million in its first round of funding, led by Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto division. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Flowcarbon wants to cut middlemen out of the process by turning carbon credits into tokens (its first is called GNT, for “goddess nature token”) that can be bought and sold on the blockchain. As it stands, carbon credits can be bought through private companies or through carbon exchanges. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Flowcarbon was co-founded by former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann, but this time he’s looking to solve a more complicated problem than infusing all office water with fruit: managing carbon offsets.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: 40% of recent job switchers are looking for a new job again
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. That being said, job switching continues to be one of the best ways to boost your stats on celebritynetworth. New research into the American job market shows that many people who recently quit their job for another one are pretty quickly itching to quit the new job, too. LinkedIn data backs that up: The company found that the share of job switchers who’d been at their previous job for less than 12 months rose by 6.5% in 2021 compared to 2020. —MK And, per the Grant Thornton survey, 40% of workers who took a new job reported a pay increase of at least 10%, more than double all other survey respondents. But 40% of that group is actively looking for another job, compared to 29% of all full-time employees—revealing some significant buyer’s remorse among job jumpers.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: At least 21 killed in elementary school shooting in Texas
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Big picture: Guns surpassed car accidents as the No. 1 cause of death among children in 2020, jumping nearly 30% between 2019 and 2020, per a research letter in the New England Journal of Medicine. Yesterday’s shooting in Texas was the 27th school shooting this year, which means one has occurred roughly every five days in 2022. It was also just one of several mass shootings across the country in the past couple weeks. Republican Senator Ted Cruz of Texas called the shooting “truly horrific,” but rejected Dems’ calls for gun reform and instead proposed stepped-up security at schools. Laguna Woods, CA: A day after the Buffalo shooting, a man was killed and four others wounded at a shooting at a Taiwanese church.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: At least 21 killed in elementary school shooting in Texas
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Big picture: Guns surpassed car accidents as the No. 1 cause of death among children in 2020, jumping nearly 30% between 2019 and 2020, per a research letter in the New England Journal of Medicine. Yesterday’s shooting in Texas was the 27th school shooting this year, which means one has occurred roughly every five days in 2022. It was also just one of several mass shootings across the country in the past couple weeks. Republican Senator Ted Cruz of Texas called the shooting “truly horrific,” but rejected Dems calls for gun reform and instead proposed stepped-up security at schools. item.title: Flowcarbon raises $70 million to tokenize carbon offsets
item.description: . css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe blockchain startup Flowcarbon landed $70 million in its first round of funding, led by Andreessen Horowitz’s crypto division. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. As it stands, carbon credits can be bought through private companies or through carbon exchanges. —JW css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Flowcarbon wants to cut middlemen out of the process by turning carbon credits into tokens (its first is called GNT, for “goddess nature token”) that can be bought and sold on the blockchain. For example, General Motors buys carbon offsets to counter tailpipe emissions. Flowcarbon was co-founded by former WeWork CEO Adam Neumann, but this time he’s looking to solve a more complicated problem than infusing all office water with fruit: managing carbon offsets.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: 40% of recent job switchers are looking for a new job again
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. New research into the American job market shows that many people who recently quit their job for another one are pretty quickly itching to ditch it. That being said, job switching continues to be one of the best ways to boost your stats on celebritynetworth. LinkedIn data backs that up: The company found that the share of job switchers who’d been at their previous job for less than 12 months rose by 6.5% in 2021 compared to 2020. —MK And, per the Grant Thornton survey, 40% of workers who took a new job reported a pay increase of at least 10%, more than double all other survey respondents. But 40% of that group is actively looking for another job, compared to 29% of all full-time employees—revealing some significant buyer’s remorse among job jumpers.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: SiriusXM acquires Conan O’Brien’s Team Coco network for $150 million
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The podcast ad market topped $1.4 billion in revenue in 2021 and is projected to exceed $4 billion by 2024. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeComedy tall-guy Conan O’Brien has sold his digital media company, Team Coco, to SiriusXM in a heavyweight deal valued around $150 million. —MK Zoom out: The nine-figure acquisition—Sirius’s largest in the podcaster space—comes two years after Spotify’s reported $200 million deal with Joe Rogan, although Conan’s show features fewer convos about ice baths and DMT. O’Brien himself signed a five-year talent agreement and will produce a comedy channel for the satellite radio company. Under the deal, Conan O’Brien Needs a Friend, Team Coco’s flagship podcast, will make the leap to SiriusXM’s pod network along with Team Coco’s network of 10 podcasts including Rob Lowe’s Parks and Recollection and Nicole Byer’s Why Won’t You Date Me? Team Coco’s staff of about 50 employees will join Sirius. Conan O’Brien Needs a Friend ranked 26th among all podcasts by weekly listeners in Q1.
item.author: Max Knoblauch

item.title: Biden says the US will help defend Taiwan, in potential policy shift
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In light of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the focus has been on what the US and other allies would do if China took its Taiwanese aggression to the next level. Why Taiwan is such a sensitive topic: Geopolitical experts say a confrontation between the US and China over Taiwan currently presents one of the top risks of war around the world. After Biden ripped up the playbook, the White House went scrambling to tape it back together, reiterating that the US’ policy on Taiwan hadn’t changed, despite what Biden said. —NF css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Klarna’s layoffs signal a broader buy now, pay later slowdown
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. For all the reasons Siemiatkowski mentioned, but also because companies made investments assuming that pandemic growth = forever growth. And Klarna’s not the only one getting a shave: Shares of Affirm, the US BNPL giant, have dropped almost 75% this year. And no one understood that better than the buy now, pay later (BNPL) startups that skyrocketed in popularity during the pandemic’s e-commerce boom.
item.author: Matty Merritt

And Klarna, the leader in helping you pay for your ASOS haul, grew its valuation from $11 billion in September 2020 to $46 billion last June. —MM Why the slowdown?
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s exposed a heavily concentrated industryAbbott and just one other company, Reckitt Benckiser, account for about 80% of the US market. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAn international flight landed in Indianapolis yesterday, and to our relief no one clapped after it touched down.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: US dollar could reach parity with the euro this year
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThanks to a surging US dollar and a faltering euro, many analysts expect that the two currencies could reach parity this year—meaning one dollar would fetch you one euro. At the same time, they’re fleeing the euro because Europe is more vulnerable to a severe economic downturn than the US. The euro closed Friday at about $1.057 against the dollar, just 5% above equal value with the US currency. Of course, the consequences of a stronger dollar go beyond cheaper European delights. Bottom line: This isn’t just a dollar > euro story; it’s a dollar > everyone story. Why is this happening? In fact, even with soaring inflation, many activities in Europe are cheaper now than they were in 2019, Bloomberg points out:Visiting the Acropolis in Athens costs $21 now, compared to $22.60 in 2019.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Mary Tobler

item.title: Spain could become the first European country to offer menstrual leave
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One curveball with a paid period leave policy: people who menstruate may not use it. But none offer a policy quite as robust as Spain’s. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeSpain’s government approved a draft bill this week that would create a nationwide menstrual leave policy for workers—meaning that if a woman gets a doctor’s note for severe period pain, they would be eligible to take government-funded PTO. In Japan, where paid period leave has been around the longest, dating back to 1947, the policy has seen a steep decline in use. Between 50%–90% of women experience pain during periods, and 33% responded that the pain prevents them from performing daily activities. As it stands, menstrual leave is about as common as a tampon commercial without women dancing in white pants.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Make it work: I was put on an interview panel and have no idea what I’m doing
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What’s important to you in a teammate and what type of questions can you ask that will measure that? css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. As the interview unfolds, ask follow-up questions: You want to be prepared, but not rigid.
item.author: Shane Loughnane

item.title: Icebreakers with…Peloton star Tunde Oyeneyin
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. When you get there, you won’t be able to enjoy it. The Houston native has become one of Peloton’s biggest celebs. You’ve said one of your goals as a Nike global ambassador is to make fitness more accessible to women and those who might be more uncomfortable in a gym. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. item.title: Old Navy tried to be more size-inclusive, but just left customers frustrated
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. But after filling the sales floor with larger sizes, the company’s sales fell faster than a silky shirt off one of their plastic hangers as customers got frustrated trying to find middle sizes, the WSJ reports. The CEO of Gap Inc., Old Navy’s parent company, called it the “largest integrated launch” in Old Navy’s history and an “important growth driver for…years to come.”
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Coca-Cola announces nearly capless bottles in the UK
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Stock market is experiencing historic rout
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Every recession since 1968 has prompted a bear market like the one we’re currently in, per CFRA Research. In fact, a big stock market sell-off is exactly what the Fed wants to see in order to slow economic activity, and in turn, bring inflation back to normal. The Dow posted its eighth straight weekly loss, which is its longest weekly losing streak since 1923. And this week, any optimism was dashed when ol’ reliables Target and Walmart posted lousy results, sending their stocks tumbling the most since the market crash of 1987.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In Japan, where paid period leave has been around the longest, dating back to 1947, the policy has seen a steep decline in use. As it stands, menstrual leave is about as common as a tampon commercial without women dancing in white pants.

item.title: Old Navy tried to be more size-inclusive, but just left customers frustrated
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Zoom out: Old Navy’s misstep is bad news for parent company Gap Inc. The brand accounted for 54% of Gap’s total sales in 2021, and Gap’s stock is already down nearly 67% in the last year. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeLast summer, Old Navy launched an ambitious gamble to become the most size-inclusive brand in your hometown mall. But Old Navy’s inclusive push apparently didn’t include any regard for sales. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! But after filling the sales floor with larger sizes, the company’s sales fell faster than a silky shirt off one of their plastic hangers as customers got frustrated trying to find middle sizes, the WSJ reports.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Stock market is experiencing historic rout
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Every recession since 1968 has prompted a bear market like the one we’re currently in, per CFRA Research. In fact, a big stock market sell-off is exactly what the Fed wants to see in order to slow economic activity, and in turn, bring inflation back to normal. The Dow posted its eighth straight weekly loss, which is its longest weekly losing streak since 1923. And this week, any optimism was dashed when ol’ reliables Target and Walmart posted lousy results, sending their stocks tumbling the most since the market crash of 1987.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Icebreakers with…Peloton star Tunde Oyeneyin
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. When you get there, you won’t be able to enjoy it. The Houston native has become one of Peloton’s biggest celebs.
